author: GamingBolt
description:
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl has finally made its way to PS5. After a year of updates and refinements, GSC Game World’s has bought one of last year’s most visually striking shooters to Sony’s console. Powered by Unreal Engine 5, it delivers dense environments, atmospheric lighting, and highly detailed assets that showcase the strengths of Epic’s latest tech. 

In this video, we examine how the PS5 version stacks up against its Xbox Series X and PC counterparts, highlighting key visual and performance differences across all three platforms. From foliage density and texture quality to frame-rate stability and load times, we break down individual aspects of the experience to determine whether GSC Game World’s latest port offers a worthwhile experience on PS5.
title: STALKER 2 PS5 vs Xbox Series X vs PC Graphics Comparison - Is Sony’s Version Secretly The Best?

author: GamingBolt
description:
I wish I could say, “Released this Friday to incredible sales and extensive criticism, as is tradition,” but this time, it's different. It's not often you reference such things when talking about Call of Duty, of all things, but it fits excruciatingly well with Black Ops 7. 

In the United Kingdom, physical sales are down 61 percent from last year's Black Ops 6 and pale in comparison to Battlefield 6. The Call of Duty app, where all things Call of Duty are primarily accessible, barely scraped by 100,000 peak concurrent players this past weekend on Steam. Compare that to last year's Black Ops 6, which still managed 306,460 players at launch while also being available on Game Pass.
title: Call of Duty Black Ops 7 - What Really Went Wrong?
